title: Feudo Maccari 2013 Saia Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)
description: Toast, espresso, black plum and leather aromas open up in the nose. The round, juicy palate delivers ripe black cherry, blackberry, dark cooking spice and a gamy note alongside fine-grained tannins that give it a firm finish.

title: Mastroberardino 2013 Redimore Aglianico (Irpinia)
description: Aromas of red berry, blue flower and dark cooking spice come together on this young red. The soft, savory palate offers wild cherry, raspberry, cocoa and cinnamon balanced by zesty acidity and polished tannins. Drink through 2018.

title: Medlock Ames 2012 Bell Mountain Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Plum jam and cranberry rise aromatically from the glass, with pretty accents of violet and cedar. Notes of baked bread add a comforting notion, while soft, sticky tannins combine with toasted oak and caramel on the midpalate and finish. There's a boldness to the structure; drink through 2020.

title: Michael David 2013 Earthquake Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Flavors are deep and rich in this bold, full-bodied and mouthfilling wine. It smells like molasses, Bing cherries and black plums, tastes as if saturated with blackcurrants and cherries and has a layer of fine-grained tannin to add texture.

title: Mud House 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: After some struck flint on the nose, this shows classic Marlborough Sauvignon characters, ranging from snow pea and cut grass to grapefruit and pineapple. It's medium bodied, with a clean, crisp finish, but should be consumed by the end of 2016.

title: Spy Valley 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: For only clocking in at 13% abv, this is remarkably full in body and rich in texture, with hints of smoke highlighting citrus and stone fruit. The finish is particularly notable for its fine chalk dust and silk feel.

title: Starmont 2013 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Light-bodied and modestly priced, this is a wine for a wide circle of friends, great for midweek meals and larger weekend gatherings. Hazelnut and caramel-honey confront the senses, while the palate offers balance and zesty acidity. The finish is soft and subtle.

title: Steindorfer 2013 Reserve Blaufränkisch (Burgenland)
description: Woodsmoke and wet earth frame black cherry fruit on the nose. The palate is cushioned with rich vanilla flavors of oak, providing the texture of starched, crushed velvet. A vein of freshness brightens everything.

title: Riboli 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Bouillon and wild streaks of spearmint and cedar highlight this soft, well-integrated red that is full-bodied and brawny, ready pair with big slabs of meat. With sizable tannin structure, it can be enjoyed now through 2020.

title: Sineann 2013 Abondante Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine blends varieties that includes Cabernet Sauvignon, Zinfandel, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Merlot. It offers fruit-forward aromas of raspberries and plum accented by herbs and flowers. Ripe and full-bodied flavors carry through the smoky finish.

title: Sleight of Hand 2014 The Spellbinder Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This blend is 53% Cabernet Sauvignon, 29% Merlot and 18% Cabernet Franc. It appeals with aromas of dried herbs, plum, mocha and flowers that are followed by lush fruit flavors that linger. It's a delicious pleaser.

title: Naggiar 2013 Della Casa Cabernet Sauvignon (Sierra Foothills)
description: This is a great find, but available only in limited quantities. A deep, dark color goes right to the rim. The aroma is like crème de cassis and the flavors suggest black grapes and blackberry jam. The texture and structure are classic Cab, as firm tannins and acidity clean the mouth after each sip.

title: Planeta 2013 Dorilli  (Cerasuolo di Vittoria Classico)
description: Silky and elegant, this offers delicate, enticing scents of wild red berry, rose, blue flower and baking spice. The linear, vibrant palate delivers Marasca cherry, crushed strawberry, anise and white pepper, accompanied by bright acidity and polished tannins.

title: Villa Maria 2014 Cellar Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: A step up in weight, texture and concentration from VM's Private Bin bottling, Cellar Selection is the middle tier of the company's Sauvignon Blancs. Delicate leafy characters mark the nose, but the emphasis is on the engaging gooseberry and pink grapefruit notes. Textures of silk and cream add richness to the palate, lingering on the mouthwatering finish.

title: Schwarzböck 2014 Aichleiten Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)
description: Rounder notions of savory yeast season the fresh flavors of green pear and continue on a clean, superslender, lemony palate that is light, zesty and ever so slightly textured. If you are looking for real refreshment, here it is in spades.

title: Setzer 2014 Reserve 8000 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)
description: The fresh peel of Conference pear unites with the spicy zest of grapefruit while white pepper shimmers everywhere. This is slender, appetizing and utterly fresh with a wonderfully savory core that fizzes with peppery spice.

title: Seven Falls 2013 GPS Jones Vineyard Zinfandel (Wahluke Slope)
description: Barrel notes of sweet spices, vanilla and coconut are up front on this wine followed by lush, full-bodied cherry and raspberry flavors. Fruit and barrel flavors linger in harmony on the finish.

title: Stift Göttweig 2014 Ried Silberbichl Reserve Riesling (Kremstal)
description: The slightest lemon touch perfumes the nose, the palate has an equally light touch: drinking this is like floating in a weightless, lemony cloud of freshness. There is wonderful balance and subtlety. Like pulling a string on a harp to elicit a high, pure note.

title: Stolo 2013 Estate Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Salted nuts, dried white flowers, orange rinds, a touch of smoke and a dollop of just enough buttercream show on the nose of this bottling from an extreme coastal vineyard just outside of Cambria. There is a lemon rind tightness to the palate that unleashes Marcona almond warmth, with lots of zing that persists for days after opening.

title: Talisman 2012 Wildcat Mountain Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From the western edge of Sonoma Valley, this robust, full-figured wine took on considerable power in this vintage. It exhibits elusive fruit before peeling back bittersweet layers of cranberry, orange peel and tea. After fresh rose on the nose, it adds an element of char to the finish.

title: Gustafson Family 2014 Heritage Tree Vineyard Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Made from a field blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sauvignon Musque, this wine is given three months in French oak. Structured, it also has a decadence of vanilla cream and pear pie surrounded by briny aromas and plenty of citrus.

title: Hajszan Neumann 2013 Zweigelt (Vienna)
description: Spicy, savory notes dominate the nose of this fresh Zweigelt which features crunchy, fresh tannins and a vein of refreshing acidity. The palate is sonorous and textured with notes of cinnamon and pepper accentuating the red and black fresh cherry fruit. This is refreshing, invigorating and appetizing.

title: Hajszan Neumann 2014 Weissleiten Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)
description: Slight flinty notes on the nose open up into flavors of ripe pear on the palate. Everything is toned by fresh citrus zest and a linear, taut body that holds ample refreshment. This is clean, zingy and slender and offers ultimate refreshment.

title: Hiedler 2014 Thal Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: Just a hint of citrus emanates from the glass. The very light-bodied palate remains very citrussy, taut, fresh and bright. Save this one for a hot summer day and it will provide ultimate refreshment.

title: Hutter 2013 Loibner Kreutles Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)
description: An overtly fragrant nose of both moss and ripe yellow pear makes for an intriguing opening. The palate has the same seductive pull of ripeness—and the accompanying warmth. But there is tone and freshness that lifts everything up and ends up as a picture of complete charm.

title: Keuka Lake Vineyards 2014 Estate Grown and Bottled Evergreen Lek Vineyard Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Opulent layers of quince, apple and tangerine seem to be glazed with honey­comb and smoke in this complex, textured wine. Dry in style, it's satisfyingly creamy on the palate, yet struck by a nervous edge of lime zest and lemony acidity. Drink now–2025 to allow its mineral complexities to deepen.
designation: Estate Grown and Bottled Evergreen Lek Vineyard Dry

title: Twisted Twig 2011 Regal Petite Sirah (El Dorado County)
description: This delicious, dark, full-bodied wine smells like blackberry jam and tastes like blueberries and dark chocolate. It has a richly tannic but not harsh texture and lingering finish. The gorgeous fruit flavors make it drinkable now, but it will mature nicely through 2020.

title: Château Tournefeuille 2013  Lalande de Pomerol
description: For a Lalande de Pomerol this wine has a high proportion (30%) of Cabernet Franc, giving a structure that shapes the ripe Merlot. It's juicy with black plums and has a core of dry tannins. Drink from 2018.

title: Cornerstone 2012 Oakville Station Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: The first Merlot offering from this producer, this is 100% varietal and totally full-throttle in its fleshy components of vanilla and chocolate, seasoned in cinnamon. Fresh and somewhat floral, it's bright despite its size and lively on the palate. The wine is made in tiny amounts.

title: Castello di Amorosa 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon with smaller amounts of Merlot, Petit Verdot and Malbec, sourced from throughout the Napa Valley, including the winery's estate Diamond Mountain vineyard. Bold and lush in cranberry and dark chocolate, it's also robust in black pepper and cedar.
